result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Regin M Tornberg

records.addlTxt:
10:17 AM Defendant Regin M Tornberg in court.  Attorney Aaron Thomas Vruwink in court for Regin M Tornberg.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Not guilty plea. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Court appoints Aaron Vruwink as counsel. Defendant must pay $100 per month commencing 10/1/22 by wage assignment, if possible
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
2:05 PM Defendant Regin M Tornberg in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Lieutenant Scott Goldberg is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being employed as a Lieutenant with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. Testifies to being involved in an investigation regarding JTK. Testifies to JTK telling officer Berres the defendant threw a bottle at him. Testifies to Deputy Berres seeing injuries that day of the victim. Testifies to JTK being under the age of 18. Testifies to speaking w/ the defendant regarding the incident. Witness identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. 

Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it.

Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on September 12, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
No contact with alleged victim, J.T.K or their residence. $5,000
No contact with alleged victim, J.T.K., or residence.

1:36 PM Defendant Regin M Tornberg appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Transferred to Branch 3 for preliminary hearing.
